intro: Aframomum geocarpum, commonly known as the underground ginger or geocarpic ginger, is a tropical plant native to West Africa. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and produces clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Its underground stems, or rhizomes, are the primary part used, containing aromatic compounds similar to ginger. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions.
